intro: Psychotria dorotheae, commonly known as the "Dorothea Psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale purple flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Psychotria dorotheae is also notable for its role in traditional medicine and its potential chemical compounds of interest in pharmacological research.
